column5: etc. I HAD TO TRY THIS PLACE. We arrived and parking was plentiful and luckily got a spot in their parking lot. Arrive early because when they run out of ribs
column6: you will be pissed. They line was almost out the door and we squeezed in and to my surprise
column7: the manning behind the counter was moving like a well oiled machine. Employees had a line assembly thing going and the line was moving. We ordered the Pulled pork
column8: and both the St. Louis and baby back ribs. On the side we chose
column9: mac and cheese and coleslaw. It was communal style seating and hosts help accommodate us.
